snippet: The aluminum maker posted a profit after reporting a loss in the fourth quarter of last year.
abstract: Alcoa posts a profit for the first quarter, surpassing analysts' forecasts for a small loss; it earned $94 million in the period, marking a turnaround from the fourth quarter, when it lost $191 million, but falling 70 percent below net income of $308 million, or 27 cents a share, posted in the first quarter of 2011; revenue rose to $6 billion from $5.96 billion.
lead_paragraph: The aluminum maker posted a profit after reporting a loss in the fourth quarter of last year.

headline.main: Alcoa Surpasses Estimates in a Bellwether Report
headline.print_headline: Alcoa Surpasses Estimates in a Bellwether Report
